meanings.definition: The state or quality of being jolly or cheerful.
meanings.sent1: The jollities of the children brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: The holiday season is filled with jollities and laughter.
meanings.sent3: The jollities of the party spilled out onto the street, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious jollities were like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The jollities of the circus performers captivated the audience.

meanings.sent1: The town square was alive with jollities during the annual festival.
meanings.sent2: The jollities of the wedding reception lasted long into the night.
meanings.sent3: The jollities of the birthday party included games and music for all to enjoy.
meanings.sent4: The jollities of the parade filled the streets with color and joy.
meanings.sent5: The jollities of the New Year's Eve party were unforgettable.
